page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: A rural area in the Sussex Weald consisting mainly of rolling farmland with woodland areas.The north of the block is mostly wooded forming the southern outskirts of Ashdown Forest. Sparsely populated, about 850, Fletching is the only village included A few houses around Sheffield Park Station plus odd farmhouses and cottages bring the total pop. to about 1000. {There are three tourist attractions { {1.}The Bluebell Railway, the first preserved Standard Gauge Passenger Railway. Trains run from Sheffield Park to Horsted Keynes.{ {2.}Sheffield Park Garden owned by the National Trust, consisting of 100 acres of garden and five lakes. {3.}Fletching Village which has associations with Simon de Montfort.
